Can be used in Recipes during the Freedom in Essos event, or converted to Trader's Scrip when the event ends. 
Part of the 'Freedom in Essos' Event

description: Spend your Sparrow Armaments before the event ends and this recipe disappears!

ingredients.description:
Brutal weaponry given to the Sparrows to enact the will of the gods. Sparrows must give up their names and earthly possessions to become closer to the Seven.

Can be used in Recipes during the Cersei, Queen of Lions event, or converted to Trader's Scrip when the event ends. 
Part of the 'Cersei Lannister' Event
ingredients.name: Sparrow Armaments

ingredients.description: A high-value currency from across the Narrow Sea. Most Westerosi will not accept these coins, but merchants will exchange them for goods in the Recipes tab of your Inventory.

description: Chest contains a 90% chance of 35 Poor crafting material or a 10% chance of 350 Poor material instead. It can be opened in your Inventory.

description: Spend your Writhing Leeches before the event ends and this recipe disappears!

ingredients.description:
A parasitic creature with a penchant for drawing blood from its host; leeches are a useful tool of the trade for maesters caring for the infirm. Some Red Priests of R'hllor have found a different purpose for them altogether…

Can be used in Recipes during the R'hllor, Lord of Light event, or converted to Trader's Scrip when the event ends. 

Part of the 'R'hllor, Lord of Light' Event

description: Spend your Targaryen-Branded Wood before the event ends and this recipe disappears!

ingredients.description:
The Red Keep was once known as the Aegonfort; a stockade atop a lonely hill above the Blackwater Bay. The surrounding township flourished under Aegon's rule and soon King's Landing became the greatest port city in all of Westeros.

Can be used in Recipes during the Aegon's Conquest event, or converted to Trader's Scrip when the event ends. 
Part of the 'Aegon's Conquest' Event

House Clegane's sigil is three black dogs on a yellow field. To many in Westeros, these banners herald destruction and death. To the Brotherhood, they are a mark of a job well done.

Can be used in Recipes during the Brotherhood Without Banners event, or converted to Trader's Scrip when the event ends. 
Part of the 'Brotherhood Without Banners' Event

Can be used in Recipes during the Tragedy at Summerhall event, or converted to Trader's Scrip when the event ends. 
Part of the 'Tragedy at Summerhall' Event

description: Spend your Throwing Knives Trophies before the event ends and this recipe disappears!

ingredients.description:
At first glance these knives are meant to add an alure of danger to the fool's juggling act. Yet the heft and handle suggest that these knives have a much more practical and deadly intent in mind...

Can be used in Recipes during the Highgarden Harvest Festival event, or converted to Trader's Scrip when the event ends. 
Part of the 'Highgarden Harvest Festival' Event
ingredients.name: Throwing Knives

ingredients.description: A high-value currency from across the Narrow Sea. Most Westerosi will not accept these coins, but merchants will exchange them for goods in the Recipes tab of your Inventory.

ingredients.name: Volantene Honor

name: Recipe: 100 Soldierpine

description: Spend your Dragon Horn Trophies before the event ends and this recipe disappears!

ingredients.description:
A horn for drinking ale, hollowed from the spine of a once proud dragon. This desecration could be seen as an insult towards those whose power resides in the great beasts of Old Valyria.

Can be used in Recipes during the The Book of Conquest event, or converted to Trader's Scrip when the event ends. 
Part of the 'Book of Conquest' Event

Can be used in Recipes during the House Baratheon event, or converted to Trader's Scrip when the event ends. 
Part of the 'House Baratheon' Event

Can be used in Recipes during the Lady of the Iron Islands event, or converted to Trader's Scrip when the event ends. 
Part of the 'Lady of the Iron Islands' Event

description: Spend your Rat Bones before the event ends and this recipe disappears!

ingredients.description:
Bones from the famished rats that nest beneath the Nightfort. Scatter these outside your door to ward off the swarm!

Can be used in Recipes during the Old Nan's Tales event, or converted to Trader's Scrip when the event ends. 
Part of the 'Old Nan's Tales' Event
ingredients.name: Rat Bones

ingredients.description: A low-value currency from across the Narrow Sea. Most Westerosi will not accept these coins, but merchants will exchange them for goods in the Recipes tab of your Inventory.
ingredients.name: Volantene Honor

name: Recipe: 10,000 Wood

description: Chest contains a 90% chance of 35 Poor crafting material or a 10% chance of 350 Poor material instead. It can be opened in your Inventory.

description:
During the ‘Feast of Cakes and Pies,’ gift Eel Pies containing resources to your friends. Use Pie Ingredients to bake Rare Eel Pies from inventory recipes. There’s no better way to show your appreciation to your allies across the realm!

 These limited-time recipes will disappear when the event is over.

ingredients.description:
Use this to bake a Rare Eel Pie, worthy of a feast.

Part of the 'Feast of Cakes and Pies' Event, these can be used in Recipes for additional rewards during the event!

This limited-time recipe is only available to Keep level 30 and above players and will disappear when the event is over.

ingredients.description:
A torn and tattered fragment from an ancient scroll. Used by your Maester to complete research.

These can sometimes be obtained by gathering entire resource nodes.

Events that reward Scholarly Fragments occur every Monday, and they are sometimes available from other events.

ingredients.description:
Found deep within the stone of a living mountain lay the remains of the dangerous creatures known as firewyrms. Old tales say they came before dragons took to the skies, but felt no love for men.

Can be used in Recipes during the Aegon's Conquest event, or converted to Trader's Scrip when the event ends. 
Part of the 'Aegon's Conquest' Event

Part of 'The Hound' Event

ingredients.description:
The Red Keep was once known as the Aegonfort; a stockade atop a lonely hill above the Blackwater Bay. The surrounding township flourished under Aegon's rule and soon King's Landing became the greatest port city in all of Westeros.

Can be used in Recipes during the Aegon's Conquest event, or converted to Trader's Scrip when the event ends. 
Part of the 'Aegon's Conquest' Event
ingredients.name: Targaryen-Branded Wood
